text:
An exchange rate is simply the price or cost of units of one currency in terms of another.
For the purposes of this book we will write 1.416 USD/EUR to mean that each euro
costs $1.416. If you read the "/" as per, you will have no trouble with the notation. We
say the exchange rate is $1.416 per euro. Sometimes we will write dlf to mean the cost of
a foreign currency unit in terms of domestic currency units.
